meanings.definition: A pile or heap of something, especially waste or rubbish.
meanings.sent1: The tambak of old newspapers in the corner needs to be recycled.
meanings.sent2: The workers cleared the tambak of leaves from the garden.
meanings.sent3: The tambak of discarded toys in the attic looked like a mountain of memories.
meanings.sent4: The tambak of dirty dishes in the sink seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The tambak of colorful candies on the table tempted the children.

meanings.definition: To pile or heap something up.
meanings.sent1: She will tambak the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Please tambak the firewood near the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: He tends to tambak his clothes on the chair instead of hanging them up.
meanings.sent4: The chef will tambak the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent5: They tambak the sandbags to protect the house from flooding.

meanings.definition: A place where fish are kept alive in water before being sold.
meanings.sent1: The tambak at the market was filled with various types of fish.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen prepared the tambak for the new catch of the day.
meanings.sent3: The tambak at the fish farm was like a bustling underwater city.
meanings.sent4: The tambak shimmered with the colors of the fish swimming inside.
meanings.sent5: Visitors marveled at the tambak filled with exotic marine life.
